website_summaries.verdict: Durable and comfortable sleeping bag for temperatures 20 to 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
pros: Fiberlock construction prevents insulation from shifting, extending life of sleeping bag
No-Snag patented zipper works like a dream
Can easily be opened fully to use as a comforter and use on top of a bed
Attach another bag to double its size and sleep more than one easily
cons: Outside fabric is too silky, making bag hard to roll tight and get back into carry bag
Interior lining may bother bare skin
May have slight chemical odor that can't be removed even with washing

customer_reviews.title: Soooooo misleading.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews of "how soft this sleeping bag is", I was super excited! Everyone said it felt like flannel... let me tell you.. that was a flat out lie. It is the WORST fabric for people with dry skin! The sound of my husbands hands across this is like nails on a chalkboard! Just snag after snag after snag! This is NOT flannel like! Dont fall for it. Not only that, when I was testing it out, I kept pulling these little plastic pieces out. Kinda like down feathers that poke through, but plastic hairs! I'll attach a picture. So incredibly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Derek webb

customer_reviews.title: I slept warmly.
customer_reviews.text: This bag kept me toasty when camping near a lake. Temp dropped to low 40s but I remained warm and comfortable. I am 5'7 275lbs and the bag fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Successfully stuffed in the stuff sack, YEAH!
customer_reviews.text: To all of the naysayers who thought it couldn't be done. IN YOUR FACE! I managed to get the sleeping bag back into the zipped up stuff sack. Any one else up to the challenge? Decent product BTW.
customer_reviews.author: hunchan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used one of these sleeping bags once and two areas have already came unsewn, which to me screams shoddy craftsmanship. The zipper at the foot of the sleeping bag and the tie down loop are no longer sewn in, so there is a hole in the foot of the bag and you can't roll the bag up and secure it. Very disappointed in the product, to say the least and unfortunately I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: H. Oneal

customer_reviews.title: size dishonestly labelled
customer_reviews.text: The description of this sleeping bag says that the size is 33x75, and the tag on the bag says the same thing. In fact, it's 30x70. That's downright dishonest. I bought an inexpensive sleeping bag, but I didn't expect a falsely labelled, cheap piece of junk (let's not even talk about the zipper or the lining). Coleman should be ashamed to have their name on this.
customer_reviews.author: katemb

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat this price so I bought 2. Looking forward to put them to use this weekend for our family camping trip. Have been using Coleman for the last 35 years. Update 9/4/18 we used them over the Labor Day weekend and they were warm and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Flawed stiching, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The stiching was flawed and in fact repair was done with white thread in places :( The product also smelled as if it was used. I returned it and ordered another one from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft, warm and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is AMAZING I am a car dweller for now and I use it in the back of car on my mattress and it keeps me warm down to at least 30 so far. We will see what it does under that. Plus is so soft and lightweight so I can sleep with it covering my head and I don't feel like I'm being suffocated. I love it ..wish I had bought it sooner. Thank you Coleman and thank you amazon for having it on black Friday deals.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Johnson

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH WARMER THAN I ANTICPATED
customer_reviews.text: this is a fantastic spring/summer/fall sleeping bag if you live in colorado. its HUGE and fluffy and reminds me of my bed at home. i was roasting in this thing last weekend and am just over the moon about this purchase. i mean, a 30 degree sleeping bag for under $40?! you've gotta be kidding me. I've spent upwards of $160 on bags the same temp rating and froze my tatas off LOL
customer_reviews.author: vstrmiskova

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First time camping family this summer so my hubby and I needed sleeping bags. These bags were warm enough for us (got down to about 45° at night) with and extra blanket and a jacket on. They are pretty plush so that was some added comfort. The only thing that I don’t like about these sleeping bags is how bulky they are. They are extremely hard to get back into their case. With the added bulk, they take up quite a bit of room in the car. Glad we had a roof cargo topper to hold all the gear!
customer_reviews.author: KateC

customer_reviews.title: Medium Weight Superb Warmth
customer_reviews.text: This bag is accurately rated and very warm-to-too-hot indoors in a 65°F room. It was perfect for 30° to 55°. Not lightweight for backpacking, but is medium and thickly padded. Extra length is good. Frog buttons on sides aid in rollup by keeping length together. Thickness makes rollup challenging. No odor. Flannel inside is cozy. Perfect for tent or car-camping. Also used as a quilt indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Z

customer_reviews.title: Narrow, no padding, can't unzip
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to zip together while we camped in high altitude but upon arriving at our camping ground we realized not only can you not unzip the sleeping bags to join them but they are also VERY narrow and thin! Whatever material they used kept you warm but there was no padding. We have a 5 month old baby who we had sleeping with us and I could not have her next to me and zip the sleeping bag up. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Stacey H.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag. I bought to replace my old Coleman cotton sleeping bag. I like this one much better. The outside nylon dries much quicker and didn't seem to attract the damp while camping. It was plenty warm while camping in the white mountains. I was surprised when it arrived as it looked so small all rolled up I suspected it wouldn't be as warm as my old one. However after unwrapping this bag plumps right up to good thickness. Which leads me to my only complaint, I have never been able to roll this bag up tight enough to fit back in it's sleeve. It's hard even getting it right enlighten to use only the ties.
customer_reviews.author: nmac

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: These were awful! I wanted to love them, because I loved the price so much. Alas, as bad as my kids are I wasn't going to punish them by making them sleep in these. The material was thin, scratchy, uncomfortable, and not warm. I didn't even have to open it all the way to know that I would not be keeping it. Amazon made returning these easy and we chose to purchase in store where we could touch and feel first before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Coleman
customer_reviews.text: I have a Coleman sleeping bag that have used for camping since 1986 and it is still going strong. I decided to retire my husband's old non-Coleman sleeping bag of 40 years that was on the small side that our son uses. So of course I went with another Coleman. It was a great price and has some nice features like toggles that help roll up the sleeping bag. Prpbably only complaint, is that it is hard to fit into the duffle bag without 2 people doing it.
customer_reviews.author: MYB

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! Unless you’re OK with purchasing trash !! I got mine today for a backpack trip got the sleeping bag in case as soon as I opened the package the zipper on the case was broken And we are all the tags were on the sleeping bag fell right off now there’s a hole in it. Trash sleeping bag for a high price!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag for low price,  however, sizes vary
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these excellent Coleman sleeping bags, planning to zip them together for use in our trailer. They were able to be zipped, however, as noted by other reviewers, there is a 3" gap at the bottom where the zippers don't quite meet. We also discovered that one bag was ~4 inches shorter than the other. We purchased the two from the same supplier, but several days apart. While we are upset that the bags are different sizes, they will still work fine in our trailer, so we kept them.
customer_reviews.author: DLn

customer_reviews.title: Seam Ripped
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our toddler daughter to use at daycare. She really enjoys how soft and plush it is. We have used it for 4 weeks and on week 3 (~9 times), a seam on the front unravelled and split. The seam has now come apart 8" and the stuffing is showing. This was washed twice in a washing machine without an agitator and was air dried. We are starting to look for patching kits, since you have to pay for insured, shipping back to Coleman. I'm really disappointed as Coleman has always been a good sleeping bag company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I gave up on the bag! Warm bag if not huge! Only appropriate for car camping for sure. That being said I woke up one morning to my tent at 21 degrees and my son was sound asleep in the bag with another over and under him. Not sure how he would have been with one bag in that frigid temperature but we’ll try it out again later next month. Inside was soft, no problems with snagging and I liked the roll up feature. Just not getting it back in the bag! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JulesAnn

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Warm!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag, it's cozy, warm, has a nice color, and is easy to zip. Due to the thickness of the filling i think saying it's 33" wide is a stretch (on the inside anyway), you probably have 29 or 30 inches inside the bag. Not a bad thing, just noteworthy because big people like to camp too (at 5'8 and around 200lbs i had no problems but there wasnt a ton of space...). I've only used it once for a 3 night camping trip but as it stands now i love this bag. Would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jade W

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag, until you need to fold it up to store.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a sleeping bag, and it’s fairly comfortable. We use it to camp in Georgia, both in southern Georgia and the mountains of north Georgia. It’s a decent weight, and provides good warmth down wn to about 40 degrees without having to bundle up any more. They’ve been used multiple times over the last two years, are are holding up well. The one thing that I’m not happy with is the cinch that you use when coiled up. It is not easy to use, and on one of the three bags we bought, it’s already broke. We bought some cheap harbor freight lashing straps to make it easier to cinch down and get into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Large, clunky, and unpackable, but maybe useful in some settings
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this may be useful as spare bedding or if your campsite is 50 feet from your car. It is not for backpacking (clunky and difficult to pack), and I would not trust this in 20°-40° weather range that is advertised. The "stuff sack" tore on the first attempt to repack the sleeping bag, so the bag is now bundled into a roll with para cord. It is also difficult to roll because the outer surface is made of some slippery textile. How much would you spend on a decent night of sleep at a hotel? Spend at least that much on a sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great bag. I agree with others on the interior fabric being a bit "grabby", but the fabric is soft- which is a huge plus. Used for 5 nights this fall and so far it appears durable. As for the stuff sack - I can only get the sleeping bag in the stuff sack, when the stuff sack if fully expanded. This is not a sleeping bag for packing into the woods, as it is bigger and bulkier than a standard mummy sack.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality; charged shipping to return
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this sleeping bag is poor. While the outside is nice, the inside is made of a cheap and very scratchy and thin material. Super uncomfortable. I did not even bother to use it. I took it out and unrolled it...and then rolled it back up and started my return. On top of that, I am being charged shipping costs to return it and therefore will probably never do business with this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: PandabearManda

customer_reviews.title: 2nd bag was delivered unpackaged
customer_reviews.text: My son gives it 5 stars. He recently took my grandson on his first camping trip with the Scouts. Grandson slept like a log in cold temps in his new bag. I have used Coleman products for over 50 years and they have never let me down. Update: changing from 5 stars to 1. I ordered a 2nd bag 2 months later which was delivered unpackaged. No box or plastic bag. Supposed to rain tonight. Update#2: Back to 5 stars as Amazon made it right.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality does not compare to other Coleman sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: When I got these in the mail I was shocked at the quality considering how high the reviews are for this product. I love coleman and we have a few of their sleeping bags, but needed some for our kids. The fabric on the inside of these is so cheap, thin and clingy. It is completely disappointing compared to the other coleman bags we own. I returned them immediately, even for the 18$ price tag.. it wasn't worth it. I would rather spend an extra 10$ per bag and get one that is softer inside, more lofty and nicer quality. We ended up getting different coleman sleeping bags, and I'm so glad I didn't settle to save a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Peppy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I really wish there were more fun colors to choose from in the adult sizes (the kids get the pretty turquoise only??!). These are very easy to connect together (although couldn't get it to the 1st time we used them, but I didn't pull hard enough). The big red part of the zipper pull was a little strange, but getting used to it. I do not like the tie to wrap it up after rolling it. You will not be able to zip the zipper on the sleeping bag's case back up after it comes out the first time, but hey it still fits in the bag :)
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea E. McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Sleep Soundly With This Bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sleeping bag to use on my bed during cool nights and often cold San Francisco summers, so that I can save money by not using my space heater. I don't know whether it will uphold in extreme weather conditions such as thirty degrees or colder, but it is sufficient for cooler weather. I like how padded it is, the quality of this product is excellent for the price. As for the inner lining, it isn't soft the way some flannel lined bags are, but it is soft enough that it is comfortable for sleeping. Overall, I am pleased with this sleeping bag, would easily purchase an extra for use by visitors!
customer_reviews.author: CCrystals121Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I love how compressed this sleeping bag is, the material is good, it's not too hot and not too cold. It packs very well and easy into the case. My friends bought other sleeping bags, it's really hard to pack up, they ended up using trash bags to bring their sleeping bags home. It keeps me warm all night long, good product, I love Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Shang

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and warm!
customer_reviews.text: Went camping on a 20 degree night and this was perfect! Not even a chill! We will be buying more. Easy to pack up and love that it is the traditional rectangle vs. the semi-circle for the head - this allows for zipping two together to create a full/queen bed. Very comfortable. This does not compress into one of those tiny packs, but I am fine with that as has a thick fill to keep warm. It is a reasonable size once rolled up and has strings/toggles to secure it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to pack it back
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it! The price is reasonable, but it's impossible to pack it back! Why, God, why did you do the packing bag so small? The zip on it looks like a bad joke! The two thread straps on it look so miserable and so weak so eventually you'll have to carry it unpacked and unrolled! I used to have many sleeping bag, and I ended up with returning it because a) it's very, VERY hard to pack it back b) the straps are very thin and weak c) the compression bag is very thin weak too d) the interior fabric is not nice for skin. No, I do not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Car-camping ready for winter trips
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a solid, car-camping and very much winter sleeping bag. Took it out to Yosemite for a first trial run on a chilly day this winter and it performed wonderfully keeping me warm all night with temps around 25(f). For car camping, I prefer a more cloth like option (washable and just more comfortable) though you certainly would not want to take this backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Good basic bag but not for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very warm sleeping bag. It's also thick, and has a soft, flannel material inside which makes it comfy. Yay. My biggest beef is that it's much heavier than expected – nearly impossible to roll up as described to put into the sack. We've given up on the rolling and just stuff the sleeping bag in, which is quite difficult to do - it's not a lightweight, stuffable material. Also, don't expect to bring this bag on a hiking trip. It's too bulky and heavy. Fine for car camping though.
customer_reviews.author: savvy_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an average sized adult (I'm 5'9", 165lb), and warm enough to sleep very comfortably in <50 degrees with no blanket on top. The only cons I'm seeing are the fine-tooth zipper (it's fine, but not as robust as I'd want to see for more rugged use), and I could see it getting claustrophobic for significantly larger people once your arms are tucked in.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Phipps

customer_reviews.title: These are the best
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the best sleeping bags I have bought for my wife and I. These bags are light and fluffy while also keeping you warm in those chili nights and mornings. We love that we do not need to take extra blankets with us because we know that these will keep us warm. We also use these in summer but we just leave them open because you will boil in them in the summer. These are for 20-50 Fahrenheit weather.
customer_reviews.author: Arjenis

customer_reviews.title: If you are over 5'6 DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Got it, opened the box, it says "For 5'11 and smaller"....oops! I am 6' and I like to be able to stretch out, when I do this, it comes to just below my chin, so this is TOO SMALL for anyone laver five and a half feet tall. Aside from that, is fairly well made and comfortable, but I sure wish they put an actual usable height on the front page!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Coleman Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought, since my camping days are over, this sleeping bag to use instead of my comforter. I opened it up and it has the same size without the hassle of duvet off and on again to wash. Dreaded that! Easy to spot clean and if it does need washing, the whole thing goes in the washer. Follow washing and drying instructions. Warm enough for cold and not do cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but still need some blanket
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is certainly thick and warm but you really need a thick blanket to cover you while you are in this in cold weather. I was in like 45 degree cold weather in the dessert and I still needed a thick blanket. As described and it’s really not hard to put back in the sleeping bag case if you do it right. Overall it’s a good buy just pack an extra Blanket.
customer_reviews.author: yaya

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Stayed in a cabin with no heater/electricity for couple of nights and the temps ranged mid 20s to 30s at night and I slept comfortably. I also like that if I buy another one in the future I can connect both sleeping bags and make it roomier if needed. We had a more expensive brand with us that I used the first night that was very uncomfortable for me and glad I was able to switch to this one for the rest of our stay in that cabin.
customer_reviews.author: BBDJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Roll Up!
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, and warm. BUT.. you can't roll it up. The tiny string they give to roll it up in the bag is so thin it's impossible to get it back in the bag it came in! Would be great if it had a stronger string to wrap it up with (velcro). Not good for a kid in boy scouts.. ended up having to shove it in a trash bag to bring it home!
customer_reviews.author: Triple L

customer_reviews.title: Not fleece lined just ok
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I am just an idiot but I thought the inside of this bag was fleece. It doesnt specifically say its fleece- but it doesnt say its not either. Inside is silky smooth not fleece like as it shows in the picture. My daughter was not happy. She has sensory issues and this bag caused huge issue during our trip. It does roll up nice and kept her warm enough but just an overall disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Aryn Amber

customer_reviews.title: BEST SLEEPING BAGS EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I normally do not bother leaving reviews, but I have to on this! My husband and I went to TN for a music festival this weekend and it was 30 degrees at night. We were so warm in our tent with these sleeping bags that it was almost too warm. They are so comfortable too. We highly recommend!!! Best sleeping bags we have found!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm, but bulky
customer_reviews.text: Loved: the warmth, the extra room, the color. Did not like: the cinching system that just cinched the middle, but did not help make the bag more compact to carry; the overall size of the bag once bag in the carrying pouch. There is actually a zipper on the side of that carrying pouch that is supposed to help make the bag smaller, but I was never able to zip it shut.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi D

customer_reviews.title: Cheapish
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. Sleeping bag, bag was ripped. First thing I saw. I inspected the actual sleeping bag and it looked okay. Feels cheap but it’s okay for the type of camping I do. I would recommend looking elsewhere. If you are just camping and not going to be in really cold weather and want cheapish this bag is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Alex A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a sleeping bag for his 6th grade trip and I did not want to spend a ton of money as we would not normally use a sleeping bag. This was an amazing value. Made it through the trip and still looks brand new and all my kids love using it! It is very warm and I love the connections that hold it so that when you roll it, it doesn't get all messed up. It is a little hard to roll it small enough to easily get it back into the carrying bag that it comes with, but that is by no means a deal breaker! If you need a sleeping bag, this is a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Rosypal

customer_reviews.title: Thick but a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: It'll probably work well for the temperature. The cover material is good for avoiding wrinkles. My problem was that it felt somewhat bulky. Could be a problem for long-distance backpacking. Do pay attention to the weight I guess. It's not filled with goose down after all. Should be good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Walden

customer_reviews.title: How to get it back in bag...
customer_reviews.text: You just start stuffing sleeping bag in the stuff sack starting with bottom of sleeping bag and just keep rotating stuff sack and stuffing in sleeping bag until you get it all in there... Seems like a good sleeping bag for the price and given that it is made in china. I had to return because the inside material didn't feel good on my skin, made me really itchy.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the internal fabric is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: These kept the kids warm in fall camping in Colorado. So they’re plenty warm but the downside in the interior fabric. It’s like a very cheap flannel type material. If you have any sort of rough skin on your feet or hands, its going to snag on the internal fabric. Other than that, these worked pretty well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Vince G.

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and warm
customer_reviews.text: These kepthings us warm aND cozy for 2 weeks while we waited for our household goods to arrive after a recent move We ordered.2. You can zip them together to make a double or leave them individual. They are pretty soft and easy to fold away I still use mind to cuddle up by the TV to stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schendel

customer_reviews.title: Once you get it out, it is never going back in.
customer_reviews.text: WOW are these comfy on a cold night. But, WOW are they impossible to get back into their carrying bags. Even with the gusset open its just not going to go back in. They made the carrying bag just a little too small. We have two of them and they are the fluffiest, coziest sleeping bags I have ever slept in.
customer_reviews.author: International Mama

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a sleeping bag (he is a trucker) for when traveling up north and at night the heater wasn't enough to keep him warm. He said he many times didn't even turn on heater and slept warm and toasty. Problem is that when you get out of it, you feel the cold! LOL Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: IsliaJ

customer_reviews.title: Warm cover whatever your need
customer_reviews.text: I use sleeping bags not for camping but for a warm cover. I am a dialysis patient. Dialysis treatment centers are cold, the cold cuts down on germs. I cover up with one of these bags and I'm warm I'm comfortable.I've been on dialysis for 9 years, I have used these bags. I also use them for a cover at home they are soft they are warm especially in the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hayre

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy
customer_reviews.text: The material is so scratchy/rough against skin - I'm sure it's great as far as warmth goes, just couldn't get past the feeling of the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: so cozy
customer_reviews.text: super soft and fluffy, we used it as a "flat sheet" on our air mattress camping this weekend when the lowest temp was 50. i realize that is not rigorous camping, but this is a really nice sleeping bag and I would have cuddled in it if it were colder temps. the duffel carry-bag is a huge bonus. I am purchasing a second because they can zip together to make one big sleeping bag for two people. please read the dimensions- I am 5'8 and my husband is 6'2, so it is a bit short unless you are a side-curl-up sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: chelleer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely did the job of keeping me warm in the cold zoo classroom and was easy to putback in bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to go on Girl Scout indoor camping trip. Definitely did the job of keeping me warm in the cold zoo classroom and was easy to putback in bag. Only issue was I'm 5'6 and I wanted to pull it over my head and I couldn't do that. I'll keep it and wear a beanie next time
customer_reviews.author: L. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: No more grouchy girl
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my friend and she heats her home with wood. Every morning, she'd come for coffee and warming up! I bought her blanket after blanket that failed to work alone or together! Now her biggest complaint is that the bag keeps her so warm that she can't tell when the fire burns low! Now she won't use anything but the Coleman Brazos Cold Weather bag.
customer_reviews.author: RD Kepple

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag that doesn’t fit back into sack
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag is nice and thick, the no snag zipper is really a plus. On the negative side, it will not go back into the stuff sack. We have other Coleman sleeping bags and another brand too and they all fit back into bags with a little effort. This does not. You cannot roll it or just stuff it in the bag. I suppose if you have a lot of time and patience you could, but when I’m packing up from a camping trip the last thing I want to do is spend 30 mins or more doing this.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: We bought two and both love them.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm with a wonderful new zipper technology that prevents it from catching the material when zipping it up or open. That is a wonderful time and frustration saver. The stuff bag is easy to use. We ordered two of them and my wife loves her's too. It is not light enough for back packing but that is not what we bought it for. We are very satisfied with these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Van Nada

customer_reviews.title: you are warm quickly- or comfortable depending on how hot/cold you like to be
customer_reviews.text: use them this weekend at bryce canyon. high was 75 low was 40 one night and 32 the last night. the first night we were very comfortble, you are warm quickly- or comfortable depending on how hot/cold you like to be. The second night i did wake up from being a bit cold, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: TheLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a great deal. The sleeping bag works as expected, no problem with zipper. It takes some time to put it back into the stuff sack but it's doable and not that bad. Sure, the microfiber lining could be annoying if you have dry skin ... I have used it only in temperature between 40-50 on air mattress in a tent ... and they were great.
customer_reviews.author: Bambine

customer_reviews.title: such a great and cheap car camping sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: such a great and cheap car camping sleeping bag! or when we have friends over they have something to use. these are pretty lightweight and so warm! I bought 2 of these for when the in-laws came to visit we went camping in Mt Hood national forest. they stayed warm all night they said and you can't beat the price for a simple sleeping bag! i would definitely buy again. I love being able to use this on not so cold nights when I don't need to use my $150 montbell sleeping bag. i love not worrying about damaging this too, because i didn't pay an arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the different color options available but chose the blue. The price is great after doing some research as well. The inside is very soft and kept me warm camping near water, alone in a tent, with the temperature getting into the 50's. I like the toggles and hoops used to keep the bag together while you roll it up as well. One feature I didn't really think much about until using is the "ZipPlow" for snag-free opening and closing (yes, I looked it up), it does what it says and the zipper worked very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Marie

customer_reviews.title: ... warm body but it can not give you a good sleep. I use it in a camping site ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK to keep you alive and still have a warm body but it can not give you a good sleep. I use it in a camping site in San Antinio on early Jan. If you use it in a warmer place , inside the car (with heat) or your room's floor with carpet under it. It will be very comfortable. By the way I saw someone said it feel like paper but I think it is soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Huang

customer_reviews.title: Really warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous sleeping bag. Used it three nights camping in the Grand Canyon with temps down to 35 degrees. I was warm and comfortable. It is heavy compared to expensive back packing bags but for a short hike of 5 miles I would carry it. For Havasupai mules carried our gear to and from the hill top. It would have been too heavy for this long steep hike.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Armendariz

customer_reviews.title: Do not tumble dry!
customer_reviews.text: The tag says you can tumble dry it at low temperature in an oversized commercial dryer, but it's not true, it burns! I want to get in contact with the seller through amazon but I can't 😡 That's the only reason why I give it two stars. It should say lay flat to dry! Now I have a burnt and raspy sleeping bag, which makes me very sad and disappointed. I want to change it for a new one please!
customer_reviews.author: paola silva

customer_reviews.title: Kept us warm on camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find these discounted so I could purchase three for our camping trip. The nights were pretty cold but the sleeping bags kept us all warm. I would definitely purchase again. The lining is not nylon, more of a fleece so things (pine needles, grass, etc.) can get stuck to the lining. The bags seem manufactured well, we had no problems with the zippers or straps.
customer_reviews.author: nds

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sleeping bag. Works as a sleeping bag should. Not something that would be taken on a hike, but perfect for family camping, glamping, or sleepovers. Getting it back into the stuff bag can be a challenge. After several uses, I have yet to get it back into the bag AND zip the bag. I have no problem getting it into the bag without zipping it up. Still works for storing, just a little bigger than it would be if i could zip it.
customer_reviews.author: JG SD

customer_reviews.title: Nice but zipper fails
customer_reviews.text: Only time I used this sleeping bag was for two nights while camping recently. The zipper failed and came off the track and I was unable to get it to reattach. It was comfortable and fairly lightweight, but I had to return it due to the zipper fail.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price, but trouble with the inside fabric...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag a couple of weeks now. I first loved it. It is good for the price but I have developed a problem with it. The inside material is rough to the touch and it makes me itch. I can not stand to be in it now. If you have rough hands and feet you will know it immediately when you get in it. The outside of the bag material is smooth and soft but not the inside. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: Good Luck BP

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These kept us warm in upper 40s temp. They do their job. The inner lining is the type that catches your dry skin. I slept without socks, and my rough heels were snagging all night, but the next night I wore socks and no more snagging. Also, we can't roll these tight enough to fit back into the sleeve without some major effort of two people. Once we do stuff them in it's nice that they're compact, but man it takes some work. Overall I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LouAnn Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Skin irritating inside material!
customer_reviews.text: There’s something in/on the inside material that irritated my riddlers skin so badly I threw it away. I tried sleeping in it and my skin started to almost burn, I couldn’t lay in it. I wouldn’t even give this to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Gerttula

customer_reviews.title: Inferior inside material
customer_reviews.text: When we got the sleeping bag it seemed to look great. Then I opened it up and it had and awful material instead of flannel. It was this material that would catch on everything. I couldn't imagine being able to get a good nights sleep. As I was rolling it up to send it back it collected little bits of anything and I would have to stop to pick out whatever it collected, so I felt like that could be a problem when camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for use during a sleepover. This sleeping bag has not even been in our possession for 12 hrs and it already has a hole at a seam. Fortunately it is an easy fix, however I feel that I shouldn’t have to fix a product that we have only owned for less than 12 hrs with minimal use. If I had purchased this at a traditional store I would have returned it. Not really worth the hassle of returning it through Amazon, especially when I need a sleeping bag 2 days. I expected better from the Coleman brand.
customer_reviews.author: Susie M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not high quality, but do the job
customer_reviews.text: Cozy and warm, but there's already a tear around the zipper from where the stitching came loose after using 2 times. Material on the inside feels cheap, the sacks they come in will never be used again due to my inability to roll them small enough, and I find the hook and tie mechanism that comes attached to them not easy to use or largely functional. Not my favorite sleeping bag, but I kept them because you can zip two together and they perform the basic functions I need. Tested down to 38 degrees F, and kept warm.
customer_reviews.author: Telly

customer_reviews.title: but it felt like everything got snagged in it
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, however, the texture of the inside flannel-like material is not pleasant. I don't know how to describe it, but it felt like everything got snagged in it..That feeling that gives you those unpleasant goosebumps. We also got a little bit of dried grass in the material, it would not come out. We tried washing it, lint rolling it and had to resort to picking the grass out blade by blade.
customer_reviews.author: Becker

customer_reviews.title: You will need two people just to get these back into the carry bags.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these sleeping bags which kept us nice and warm during the last camping trip which dropped into the 40s at night. The only issue I mainly had with this sleeping bag is that it is very difficult for one person to roll up the bag tightly in order to be able to place the sleeping back into the carry bag. Otherwise for the price it is a good sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: The cord lock fell off after the first wash
customer_reviews.text: It's a machine washable sleeping bag so nothing should tear off when it's washed according to instructions. It wasn't even used yet, just washed, and the cord is already useless. What kind of quality is that?
customer_reviews.author: J. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great value and well constructed!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, warm even at 20 degrees and well constructed. Highly recommended especially for the part on the zipper that keeps you from sipping parts of the sleeping back up in the zipper - fantastic feature.
customer_reviews.author: W. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: It is warm....
customer_reviews.text: I am chicken when it comes to cold temperatures. Ordered this sleeping bag to take on a camping trip in October to Vermont when husband sternly refused to share his sleeping bag. The temperatures dropped to lower 30s. But this bag kept me warm all night and woke up warm as a toast in the morning. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P Gupta

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for camping at shenandoah national park in October
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for camping at shenandoah national park in October. It was 38 degrees at night and we were toasty. We made the mistake of wearing too many layers the first night, but the second we stripped down a little and the sleeping bags did their job. However, i just got the two of them back in their bags and Jesus. I think I deserve a medal. I'm an engineer, a yoga teacher and I play roller derby. I possess at least the average physical and intellectual prowess, but this was a tough time. I'd appreciate more realistic sized bags.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Purchased two sleeping bags for a camping trip near the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two sleeping bags for a camping trip near the beach. Kept myself and my significant other warm during the cold nights. Only downside was trying to fold and roll the sleeping bags up to fit it in the bag it came in. HA-HA. That ain't happening.
customer_reviews.author: Berudandi

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for 6"1
customer_reviews.text: I slept very comfortably in this sleeping bag. It was cozy and warm enough to endure the coldness of the winter. Although I did not sleep in it during camping outside, I am sure that it would keep my body warm.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality at a very low price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sleeping bag for one of my nephews, who, along with his brother, just joined Boy Scouts. They both needed sleeping bags for future camping trips. Rather than purchase child size sleeping bags, I decided to purchase adult size ones so they could hopefully have them for a long time to come. This sleeping bag seems to be of excellent quality, and I was able to snag it at an amazing price. The only down side is that the sleeping bag did not come boxed, so it won't be the easiest thing to wrap (hello, gift sack!). Regardless, I know it will be a big hit at Christmas! Thank you, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: mdgrl79

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but difficult to get back in the bag!
customer_reviews.text: My son likes his new sleeping bag, and it will be used often for Boy Scout camping. The problem is that is is SUPER DIFFICULT to get back into the original bag. I am an Eagle Scout, a long time camper, etc. and after seven tries we still can't get it int he bag. Come on Coleman, how about giving us a little more room to get it back in the original bag. And this isn't a new complaint, you can see the same thing said on several other versions of their sleeping bags!
customer_reviews.author: William Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Nice Car Camping Bag - stuff sack worthless
customer_reviews.text: Hey, this is not a great backpacking sleeping bag, but it sure is comfortable for car camping. Bought two - this and the 40-60F one - for my wife. Now she has a warm weather and cold weather. They both zip together. Flip the right temperature one to the top and have a bed for two. Forgot how nice having a fleece lined sleeping felt. The no-snag zipper is a joke, wished they just used a normal zipper. The stuff sacks aren't even a joke because you'll never get the bag back into it - even with it fully expanded. Amazing that I spent more on a good stuff sack than I did on the sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Pack Away BUT 10/10 Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing quality, it is a bit heavy, but I wanted that to protect against the cold night and morning. It is true what everyone else is saying about packing it back up, but I got it back in the bag (unzipped) no problem. Took two tries of MANHANDLING the hell out of it! I'm convinced I'll never see it as small again as it came. I also suppose this would be really hard for a kid to pack up all by himself. But seriously how can you give this a low rating in the least for that? The bag itself is GREAT. I can't wait to go camping now.
customer_reviews.author: Nope.avi

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable material inside. Great features, like a light pocket inside for easy access after dark, little clips on the side to keep it folded in half when you roll. Hell if I know how they ever got it rolled right enough to put into the stuff sac. The zippered stuff sac tightening is a bit silly, since I can't get the zipper started to begin with. Would rather have cinch straps to really squeeze it down.
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Such a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Weather could handle keeping me warm in colder temperatures but had no problem staying comfortable throughout the night. Open unit up and getting out in the morning what's the problem :-) lightweight easy to use and I will probably be purchasing a second one to zip together to make it comfortable for two in the near future. The internal lining is also very soft and comfy. I will be recommending it to friends
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: zipper broke after one use.
customer_reviews.text: I probably just got a bad one cause Coleman great brand but zipper broke after one use.. so waste of money.. too late to return..
customer_reviews.author: D. Curtin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable night's rest
customer_reviews.text: We used the Coleman sleeping bag for a recent camping trip. It got down to about 40 degrees at night and I was very comfortable in it. The inner lining is very soft and good to sleep in. Definitely light weight and easy to pack. The only problem we have is in it is it is very bulky so takes up more room in the car. Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rennie Tomala

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandsons. They are as thick and warm as advertised. The interior bedding is soft and also made of a material that is warm when put against the skin. I wish the bags they fit in were a little bigger. They are a bit difficult to roll back up and I wasn't able to get them back into their bags they came with. Yet, the bags themselves are great and the price is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Workable unless you have chemical allergies
customer_reviews.text: Warm enough and soft enough for summer usage but I could not use it for my intended purpose. This item came with a slightly chemically odor I can't wash out. It was intended for my very chemically sensitive autist son and he can't go near it. Instant hives. So I ended up giving him mine and using it instead. I'll have to buy something much heavier for winter, too.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser Roberts

customer_reviews.title: It keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: took it out in 21°f with a ground pad and I slept great I was wearing a hoodie and pants and thermal socks while in it as well but think I would have been fine without them even my feet stayed warm. it is a bit bulky and a little heavy for backpacking but for normal camping trips it is great and plenty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Riverratskippy youtube

customer_reviews.title: It is GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent cold weather sleeping bag. I went camping and it was very helpful. I did not feel cold at all. The only annoying part is that it is really hard to roll it and put it back into its bag.
customer_reviews.author: batuhan

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, no roll up
customer_reviews.text: So I read alot of reviews. Firstly, it is nice quality and thickness. Unfortunately it will never fit back in the small bag it came in. I thought people were just being silly or weak but truth is it's never going back in the bag. I bought it not needing it to so no big loss.
customer_reviews.author: P. Binder

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem with Coleman products in the past, but this sleeping bag didn't even last two nights. It was warm enough, but I noticed seems on multiple parts of the bag were ripped when I woke up after night two of camping. Also the stuff sack has a zipper that you can not keep zipped after the first time you take it out because the bag it too big and the draw string to tighten the bag after rolling is so slack it was a bit difficult to stuff it in each when I rolled it back up. Overall it is just a disappointment and I'll be investing in a different bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is good enough to keep you warm overnight, but has not enough thickness to keep you comfy. However, it’s easy to fold, clean and carry on. For the price, it’s a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: HSantos

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for camping, not so good on a motorcycle trip as it rolls up huge.
customer_reviews.text: ADV Rider Bought this bag to use on a motorcycle trip and ended up using a different one instead as I could not get it to roll back up tightly or small enough. It is a great bag and I like using it I just can not get it to roll up small enough to take it with me on trips. Otherwise it is a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rapturee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Fall camping
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for fall camping! We ordered this for our son for BSA camping in the fall and he was so cozy warm in 40 degree temps for the night. It’s difficult to get the sleep bag back into the bag it came in but that was the least of our worries.
customer_reviews.author: jmpaugh

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it back in the bag - major downside
customer_reviews.text: I'm a journalist, so I bought this while covering the hurricanes in NC. The bag is generally as described, but there are some major cons. - The interior fabric is scratchy and not great - How on earth do you compress it enough to get it back in the bag? It seems impossible.
customer_reviews.author: AbbieRBennett
